```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall x : Teacher, y : Class | some z : Group | y->x->z in Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired {\ninv11[] iff inv11_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv12_OK {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\nassert inv12_Repaired {\ninv12[] iff inv12_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv13_OK {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\nassert inv13_Repaired {\ninv13[] iff inv13_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv14_OK {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\ninv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv15_OK {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n--- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv3_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv4_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv5_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv6_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv7_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv8_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv9_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv10_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv11_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv12_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv13_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv14_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv15_Repaired expect 0\npred repair_pred_1{inv12[] iff inv12_OK[] }\nrun repair_pred_1\nassert repair_assert_1{inv12[] iff inv12_OK[] }\ncheck repair_assert_1"

```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & ```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & inv12_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv13_OK {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\nassert inv13_Repaired {\ninv13[] iff inv13_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv14_OK {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\ninv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv15_OK {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n--- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv3_Repaired repair_pred_1{inv12[] iff inv12_OK[] }\nrun repair_pred_1\nassert repair_assert_1{inv12[] iff inv12_OK[] }\ncheck repair_assert_1"

Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired {\ninv11[] iff inv11_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv12_OK {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\nassert inv12_Repaired {\ninv12[] iff inv12_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv13_OK {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\nassert inv13_Repaired {\ninv13[] iff inv13_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv14_OK {\nall s : Person, c : Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible **TOOL:**
```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nno Class.Groups.Teacher\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred {
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */ sig Person  { /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */ Tutors : set Person, /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */ Teaches : set Class } /* The registered groups. */ sig Group {} /* The registered classes. */ sig Class  { /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */ Groups : Person -> Group } /* Some persons are teachers. */ sig Teacher extends Person  {} /* Some persons are students. */ sig Student extends Person  {} /* Every person is a student. */ pred inv1 { Person in Student } /* There are no teachers. */ pred inv2 { no Teacher } /* No person is both a student and a teacher. */ pred inv3 { no Student & Teacher } /* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */ pred inv4 { Person in (Student + Teacher) } /* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */ pred inv5 { some Teacher.Teaches } /* Every teacher has classes assigned. */ pred inv6 { Teacher in Teaches.Class } /* Every class has teachers assigned. */ pred inv7 { Class in Teacher.Teaches } /* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */ pred inv8 { all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches } /* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */ pred inv9 { all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher } /* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */ pred inv10 { all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups) } /* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */ pred inv11 { all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c } /* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */ pred inv12 { all t0, t1 : Teacher | some c : Class, g : Group | c->t0->g in Groups implies t1->c in Teaches } /* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */ pred inv13 { Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student } /* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers * assigned to that class. */ pred inv14 { all s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors } /* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */ pred inv15 { all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s }"
}

Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* {
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */ sig Person { /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */ Tutors : set Person, /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */ Teaches : set Class } /* The registered groups. */ sig Group {} /* The registered classes. */ sig Class { /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */ Groups : Person -> Group } /* Some persons are teachers. */ sig Teacher extends Person {} /* Some persons are students. */ sig Student extends Person {} /* Every person is a student. */ pred inv1 { Person in Student } /* There are no teachers. */ pred inv2 { no Teacher } /* No person is both a student and a teacher. */ pred inv3 { no Student & Teacher } /* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */ pred inv4 { Person in (Student + Teacher) } /* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */ pred inv5 { some Teacher.Teaches } /* Every teacher has classes assigned. */ pred inv6 { Teacher in Teaches.Class } /* Every class has teachers assigned. */ pred inv7 { Class in Teacher.Teaches } /* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */ pred inv8 { all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches } /* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */ pred inv9 { all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher } /* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */ pred inv10 { all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups) } /* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */ pred inv11 { all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c } /* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */ pred inv12 { all t:Teacher | some c:Class, g:Group | c->t->g in Groups } /* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */ pred inv13 { Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student } /* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers * assigned to that class. */ pred inv14 { all s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors } /* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */ pred inv15 { all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s }"
}

To fix the error, you should modify the constraint inv13 to: "Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored." Additionally, ensure that the constraint inv14 is updated to: "Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers assigned to that 
class."
**Tool:** 
```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired {\ninv11[] iff inv11_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv12_OK {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\nassert inv12_Repaired {\ninv12[] iff inv12_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv13_OK {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\nassert inv13_Repaired {\ninv13[] iff inv13_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv14_OK {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\ninv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv15_OK {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n--- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv3_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv4_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv5_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv6_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv7_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv8_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv9_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv10_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv11_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv12_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv13_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv14_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv15_Repaired expect 0\npred repair_pred_1{\nall t : Teacher | some t.Teaches\n}\nrun repair_pred_1\nassert repair_assert_1{inv12[] iff inv12_OK[] }\ncheck repair_assert_1"

inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred **Tool:** 
```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\n\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert ```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF **Trial 1:**

**Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
/* The registered persons. */
sig Person  {
    /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */
    Tutors : set Person,
    /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */
    Teaches : set Class
}
/* The registered groups. */
sig Group {}
/* The registered classes. */
sig Class  {
    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */
    Groups : Person -> Group
}
/* Some persons are teachers. */
sig Teacher extends Person  {}
/* Some persons are students. */
sig Student extends Person  {}
/* Every person is a student. */
pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}
/* There are no teachers. */
pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}
/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */
pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}
/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */
pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */
pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */
pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
/* Every class has teachers assigned. */
pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */
pred inv8 {
    all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */
pred inv9 {
    all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */
pred inv10 {
    all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */
pred inv11 {
    all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}
/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */
pred inv12 {
    all t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}
/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */
pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}
/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers
* assigned to that class. */
pred inv14 {
    all s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}
/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */
pred inv15 {
    all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}
```

**Request:** 
```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n    /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\n    Tutors : set Person,\n    /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\n    Teaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\n    Groups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\n    Person in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\n    no Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\n    no Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\n    Person in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\n    some Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\n    Teacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\n    Class in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\n    all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\n    all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\n    all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\n    all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\n    all t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\n    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\n    all s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\n    all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}"
}
```

```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & ```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",

The registered groups. */ sig Group {} /* The registered classes. */ sig Class { /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */ Groups : Person -> Group } /* Some persons are teachers. */ sig Teacher extends Person {} /* Some persons are students. */ sig Student extends Person {} /* Every person is a student. */ pred inv1 { Person in Student } /* There are no teachers. */ pred inv2 { no Teacher } /* No person is both a student and a teacher. */ pred inv3 { no Student + Teacher } /* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */ pred inv4 { Person in Student + Teacher } /* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */ pred inv5 { some Teacher.Teaches } /* Every teacher has classes assigned. */ pred inv6 { Teacher in Teaches.Class } /* Every class has teachers assigned. */ pred inv7 { Class in Teacher.Teaches } /* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */ pred inv8 { all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches } /* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */ pred inv9 { all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher } /* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */ pred inv10 { all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups) } /* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */ pred inv11 { all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c } /* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */ pred inv12 { no Person.~(Class.Groups) } /* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */ pred inv13 { Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student } /* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers assigned to that class. */ pred inv14 { all s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors } /* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */ pred inv15 { all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s }"

Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible ```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t:Teacher | all c:Class |some g:Group | t in Person\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\n\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired {\ninv11[] iff inv11_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv12_OK {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\nassert inv12_Repaired {\ninv12[] iff inv12_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv13_OK {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\nassert inv13_Repaired {\ninv13[] iff inv13_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv14_OK {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\ninv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv15_OK {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n--- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv3_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv4_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv5_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv6_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv7_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv8_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv9_Repaired expect 0\ncheck Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student + Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t:Teacher, c:Class, s:Student | some g:Group | t->c in Teaches implies c->s->g in Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n--- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv3_Repaired ```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred ensure that inv12[] is equivalent to inv12_OK[].
**Tool:** run_alloy_analyzer
```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & **Tool:** `run_alloy_analyzer`

```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall c:Class,t:Teacher,g:Group | one c.Groups.g\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored by teachers. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert ```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff **Trial 1:**

**Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
/* The registered persons. */
sig Person  {
    /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */
    Tutors : set Person,
    /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */
    Teaches : set Class
}
/* The registered groups. */
sig Group {}
/* The registered classes. */
sig Class  {
    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */
    Groups : Person -> Group
}
/* Some persons are teachers. */
sig Teacher extends Person  {}
/* Some persons are students. */
sig Student extends Person  {}
/* Every person is a student. */
pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}
/* There are no teachers. */
pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}
/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */
pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}
/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */
pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */
pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */
pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
/* Every class has teachers assigned. */
pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */
pred inv8 {
    all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */
pred inv9 {
    all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */
pred inv10 {
    all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */
pred inv11 {
    all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}
/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */
pred inv12 {
    some c : Class | (some p : Person, g : Group | c->p->g in Groups) implies all t : Teacher | t->c in Teaches
}
/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */
pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}
/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers
* assigned to that class. */
pred inv14 {
    all s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}
/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */
pred inv15 {
    all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}
/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/
pred inv1_OK {
    Person in Student
}
assert inv1_Repaired {
    inv1[] iff inv1_OK[]
}
---------
pred inv2_OK {
    no Teacher
}
assert inv2_Repaired {
    inv2[] iff inv2_OK[]
}
--------

}
assert inv3_Repaired {
    inv3[] iff inv3_OK[]
}
--------

    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
assert inv4_Repaired {
    inv4[] iff inv4_OK[]
}

pred inv5_OK {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
assert inv5_Repaired {
    inv5[] iff inv5_OK[]

pred inv6_OK {

}

    inv6[] iff inv6_OK[]

    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}

    inv7[] iff inv7_OK[]
}

    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for at least one group. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\npred inv10 {\nall
